# Possible paths between 2 vertices
## Medium 
<div class="problem-statement">
                <p></p><p><span style="font-size:18px">Given a Directed Graph. Count the total number of ways or paths that exist between two vertices in the&nbsp;directed graph. These paths doesnâ€™t contain any cycle.<br>
<strong>Note:&nbsp;</strong>Graph doesn't contain multiple edges, self loop and cycles and the two vertices( source and destination) are denoted in the example.</span></p>

<p><br>
<span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Example 1:</strong></span></p>

<pre><span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Input:</strong>
</span><img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," class="img-responsive"><span style="font-size:18px">
<strong>Output:</strong> 4
<strong>Explanation</strong>: 
There are 4 paths from 0 to 4.
0 -&gt; 4
0 -&gt; 1 -&gt; 4
0 -&gt; 2 -&gt; 4
0 -&gt; 1 -&gt; 3 -&gt; 2 -&gt; 4</span><span style="font-size:18px">
</span></pre>

<p><br>
<span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Example 2:</strong></span></p>

<pre><span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Input:</strong>
</span><img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," class="img-responsive"><span style="font-size:18px">
<strong>Output:</strong> 3
<strong>Explanation</strong>:
There are 3 paths from 0 to 3.
0 -&gt; 3
0 -&gt; 1 -&gt; 3
0 -&gt; 1 -&gt; 2 -&gt; 3
</span></pre>

<p><br>
<span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Your task:</strong><br>
You donâ€™t need to read input or print anything. Your task is to complete the function&nbsp;<strong>countPaths()</strong>&nbsp;which takes the integer V denoting the number of vertices and adjacency list as input parameters and returns &nbsp;the count of&nbsp;&nbsp;the number of paths in the graph from the source vertex to the destination vertex.</span></p>

<p><br>
<span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Expected Time Complexity:&nbsp;</strong>O(V!)<br>
<strong>Expected Auxiliary Space:&nbsp;</strong>O(V)</span></p>

<p><br>
<span style="font-size:18px"><strong>Constraints:</strong><br>
1 â‰¤ V, E â‰¤ 100<br>
1 â‰¤ source, destination&nbsp;â‰¤ V</span></p>
 <p></p>
            </div>
